answers.answer: Well if your midwife proscribed it I'M sure it's fine to take. She wouldn't give you something that will hurt you.
Call her and ask why she didIf you have thick blood  or a high blood pressure then a low dose should be alright.She must have had her reasons to prescribe this.
Umm I would ask why you have to take it.  Its a blood thinner and can cause a higher chance of hemorrhage at delivery.
well because i have high bp and at risk of preeclampsia thats why ive been given it, phew panic over! Thanks for ur help ladies x
Im 29wks and have high bp when pregnant and I've been prescribed it. It's perfectly safe. Ive been told to stop taking it at 36wks x

Thanks natjayne, im glad its safe to take the low dose as preeclampsia isnt really common in moat pregnancies i was a little worried and hesitant at first, but if its helping both me and baby i'll happily do as im told lol x

question: Hey ladies im 12 weeks and my midwife rang my gp and told them to prescribe me low dose asprin, but the receptionist didnt tell me what for, ive read the leaflet inside and it says low dose asprin is to lower blood pressure and thin blood, but im not sure what ive been given it for, i had blood taken last week so maybe this is why but im scared to take it because ive read that it can cause miscarriage, anyone else taken it during pregnancy and is it safe? X
title: asprin???
